title: A Kitchen in France - A Year of Cooking in My Farmhouse (gnv64)
description:
A Kitchen in France: A Year of Cooking in My Farmhouse
by Mimi Thorisson
Clarkson Potter | October 2014 | ISBN-10: 080418559X | ePUB | 153 pages | 54.1 mb

With beguiling recipes and sumptuous photography, A Kitchen in France transports readers to the French countryside and marks the debut of a captivating new voice in cooking.
When Mimi Thorisson and her family moved from Paris to a small town in out-of-the-way MÃƒÂ©doc, she did not quite know what was in store for them. She found wonderful ingredientsÃ¢â‚¬â€from local farmers and the neighboring woodsÃ¢â‚¬â€and, most important, time to cook. Her cookbook chronicles the familyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s seasonal meals and life in an old farmhouse, all photographed by her husband, Oddur. MimiÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s convivial recipesÃ¢â‚¬â€such as Roast Chicken with Herbs and CrÃƒÂ¨me FraÃƒÂ®che, CÃƒÂ¨pe and Parsley Tartlets, Winter Vegetable Cocotte, Apple Tart with Orange Flower Water, and Salted Butter CrÃƒÂ¨me CaramelÃ¢â‚¬â€will bring the warmth of rural France into your home.

About the Author <a href="
http://s16.postimg.org/ddwxf6l11/mimi.jpg" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://s16.postimg.org/ddwxf6l11/mimi.jpg</a>
Born in Hong Kong to a French mother and Chinese father, Thorisson had previously worked as a journalist for CNN, and so the urge to keep writing was strong. Mimi Thorisson is a food blogger of Manger (http://mimithorisson.com). She lives with her photographer husband Odur & six children (Tiger-Mia, 10, Hudson, 7, Louise, 5, GaÃƒÂ¯a, 2, together with her two step-children Gunnhildur, 16, and Thorir, 14). The pair first met by chance in Paris at a Fashion Week party. Oddur was based in Iceland at the time and Thorisson was working in television. They also share a great passion for dogs and count nearly 20 Jack Russells and smooth Fox Terriers in their brood.
